meanings.definition: The act of interpreting or understanding something in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: Her construals of the story always leaned towards the optimistic side.
meanings.sent2: Different people may have different construals of the same event.
meanings.sent3: His construals of the teacher's instructions led to some hilarious misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: In her construals, the world was a giant puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The artist's construals of nature brought a new perspective to the viewers.

meanings.definition: The way in which something is perceived or understood.
meanings.sent1: The construals of the painting varied among the art critics.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the construals of ancient texts can be challenging.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's construals of bedtime involved elaborate bedtime stories.
meanings.sent4: In the construals of a child, a cardboard box can be a spaceship.
meanings.sent5: The construals of reality in his mind were colorful and imaginative.
